intro: Ranunculus sulphureus, commonly known as the sulphur yellow buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features bright yellow flowers with five to eight petals, often surrounded by a ring of yellow sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
